tweets.text:
Read our latest update for #WalleysQuarry landfill site here üëâhttps://t.co/o558iAVicn

We're visiting the surrounding area on an almost daily basis to carry out odour amenity checks. We're also continuing to inspect the site, including monitoring the progress of the capping. https://t.co/FsLQlvsU0f
@EnvAgencyMids Do the checks you are carrying out leave you confident of enough progress being made on the site? I'm really hoping so ü§û
@EnvAgencyMids Did your review on the 13th show any reason for the increased complaints and smell?  Rather worrying that we are 2 weeks from the 30th and the smell is getting worse.

@EnvAgencyMids People are not stupid, treat them with contempt and it will come back to haunt your organisation. It will take one person to die from this to explode into a national scandal. We cannot keep warning you. Act now. !

@EnvAgencyMids It‚Äôs 3 weeks since you collected samples of water from the burst pipe on the site.   Have you finished analysing yet ?
Why haven‚Äôt we heard about the analysis?

@EnvAgencyMids You do realise that no one has any confidence in your organisation nor @RedIndustries2 . We will continue our fight until this eyesore (in every sense ) is closed down . @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off

Don‚Äôt forget to register now for our free #preventingplasticpollution virtual workshop for businesses to be held at 10-12 on Monday 19 April co-hosted by @EnvAgency & @GreentechSouth as part of our @Plastic_EU project. @BITCenvironment @hantschamber @solentlep https://t.co/gJqnHzRe4a

@EnvAgency Pleased about additional monitors for #WalleysQuarry but unless staff are visiting the area overnight you will still have no concept of how bad the odour gets. Remember you failed to substantiate the @WHO breaking odour's existence using odour patrols! @StinkStopthe

@AaronBell4NUL Additional monitoring is encouraging but I'm disappointed there's been no further release of data by @EnvAgencyMids or @PHE_uk since the single bit of info that the @WHO health guideline was exceeded on one day. I'm sure more could be available. @StinkStopthe
On patrol with @EnvAgencySE with regards to reports of poaching at certain fisheries in Sussex - #Operationtraverse #Operationclampdown https://t.co/9Zni0qEQJD

If you are a business that produces or uses plastic, this workshop and round table discussion could be for you! Join @EnvAgency, @GreentechSouth to see how you can start your journey to tackling plastic waste https://t.co/rhrpECvr7S

#Solent #preventingplasticpollution üëá https://t.co/SsFfP22HTH

Well done for catching them.  I saw your clip posted on Facebook by SE Rivers Trust who said @EnvAgency are on the case.  @pippamaslin @MarkGale @harryhpalmer @MitchamCrktGrn @MitchamSociety I would like to see a response from @Merton_Council  as clients.  @MartinWhelton? https://t.co/2cheU1zstm

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Hit the nail on the head üëç It's much more than a nuisance odour. It's causing serious stress, sleep deprivation, issues with breathing, migraine, sickness, and so on. I've read some scientific articles and the long-term effects of regular exposure to landfill gasses is scary üòî

Much more than a nuisance odour (although that‚Äôs bad enough)- a thick dense gas invading homes frequently & causing health effects & great distress to the community . The @EnvAgency should be held to account for their ineffective regulation of the perpetrators  @StinkStopthe https://t.co/CdTG3E03c9

tweets.text:
Just 14% of English rivers are of good ecological standard, according to the @EnvAgency.

Just 7% of the UK's woodlands are in a good condition, according to the @WoodlandTrust.

We think we're a green and pleasant land, but it's a myth. When are we going to value nature?

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland We're 1.2 miles away and it's unbearable. I am breathing it in as we speak. I'm considering getting a purifier but they're really expensive and the burden shouldn't be on us: it shouldn't be an issue and we shouldn't be subjected to this poor level of air quality [1/2]

@SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @MattHancock @BorisJohnson The news coverage is very welcome but they failed to get the message over that homes over 2 miles away are being badly affected. Staffs CC health official seems to be equally unaware when he advised us to close windows & open again when the stink has gone! They just don‚Äôt get it

tweets.text: Dear @Jacob_Rees_Mogg & @EnvAgencySW. We had to go all the way to a public inquiry, without the support of @bathnes, to stop Mark Foley dumping asbestos in this quarry. So he dumps 100,000 tons of hazardous-waste instead. We warned you. Repeatedly. There must be another inquiry. https://t.co/skkkjIGeT3

tweets.text: @Vig79 @EnvAgency @riverlevel_2135 @Merton_Council Thanks Ian. We are aware of the issue and have visited the site. If anyone sees any pollution into rivers please report it on 0800 807060

Anyone know why builders at Mitcham Bridge are dumping waste into the River Wandle? I recorded this today at 3:15. #wandle @EnvAgencySE  @EnvAgency @riverlevel_2135 @Merton_Council https://t.co/czmoLpKGHd

@SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @MattHancock @BorisJohnson Never mind we are all getting letters from @EnvAgency do all will be well then !!! What an utter waste of paper , money and time . It‚Äôs the same blurb they email/put on their website . https://t.co/YxrxAI1lXj
